summary: This document is a forwarded email chain from whistleblower Christopher Dilorio to the Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN) and others, alleging widespread corruption at the SEC and connections between Apollo Global Management, Jeffrey Epstein, and Jared Kushner. It claims the SEC enables financial fraud through shell companies and that Apollo received favorable treatment after assisting Kushner's business.

persons.name: Christopher Dilorio
persons.context: Author of the email chain, making allegations of SEC corruption and connections between Apollo, Epstein, and Kushner. Claims to be a whistleblower.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Alleged to be running an extortion/Ponzi/slush fund and connected to Apollo Global Management through financial dealings, specifically via the shell company Environmental Solutions Worldwide (ESWW).

persons.name: Jared Kushner
persons.context: Son-in-law and senior aide to President Trump. Allegedly received financial assistance from Apollo for 666 Fifth Avenue, and met with Apollo's Joshua Harris at the White House.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Described as a 'Milken protege' and 'degenerate'. Allegedly involved with the shell company ESWW and connected to Epstein.

persons.name: Joshua Harris
persons.context: Another 'Milken protege' and Apollo founding partner. Allegedly met with Kushner at the White House and was considered for a White House job.

persons.name: Marc Rowan
persons.context: Mentioned as part of the 'Apollo/Epstein degenerate' group alongside Leon Black and Joshua Harris.

persons.name: George Economou
persons.context: Allegedly involved in money laundering through his company DryShips, with connections to Marc Bistricer and, by alleged extension, Jared Kushner.

persons.name: Marc Bistricer
persons.context: Toronto-based investor allegedly involved with George Economou's DryShips, described as part of a money laundering operation.

persons.name: Stephanie Avakian
persons.role: Co-Director of SEC Division of Enforcement
persons.context: Named as part of alleged 'home cooking' where the SEC dropped an investigation into Apollo after Kushner met with Apollo's Joshua Harris.

persons.name: Howard Heiss
persons.context: Attorney with a focus on securities matters, linked in the email to Apollo and Kushner.

persons.name: Jamie Gorelick
persons.context: High-profile Washington litigator mentioned in the context of the legal and regulatory landscape surrounding the allegations.

persons.name: Robert Mueller
persons.context: Mentioned as having joined the law firm WilmerHale, providing context for the legal network discussed.

persons.name: Stephen Feinberg
persons.context: Billionaire investor chosen by Trump to lead an intelligence advisory panel. Allegedly connected to money laundering bank HSH and George Economou.

persons.name: Andrew Ekonomou
persons.context: Attorney on Trump's Russia investigation legal team, noted for sharing a surname with George Economou and being based in Atlanta.

persons.name: Tricia Kline
persons.context: Mentioned in a linked article as a White House official who spoke out on security clearance controversies, referenced by Dilorio.

connections.description: Alleged connection through the shell company Environmental Solutions Worldwide (ESWW), where Epstein's Financial Trust Company Inc. filed alongside Black/Apollo entities.

connections.person1: Apollo Global Management (Leon Black, Joshua Harris, Marc Rowan)
connections.description: Apollo provided a $180 million loan to Kushner's family real estate business for 666 Fifth Avenue and Joshua Harris met with Kushner at the White House.
Bistricer-led investment house Kalani lent money to Economou's struggling company DryShips, alleged to be part of a money laundering scheme.
Met at the White House; Kushner reportedly discussed a White House job for Harris.
Allegation that the SEC dropped an investigation into Apollo shortly after Apollo aided Kushner's company.

events.title: SEC approves another alleged fraud
events.description: The SEC approved a registration statement for a company Dilorio alleges is a money laundering shell connected to AQR, George Economou, and others.

events.title: SEC drops Apollo investigation
events.description: The SEC dropped an investigation into Apollo Global Management a month after the firm gave Jared Kushner's family business a $180 million loan.

events.title: Kushner-Harris White House meeting
events.description: Jared Kushner met with Apollo co-founder Joshua Harris at the White House, where a potential White House job for Harris was discussed.

events.title: Apollo receives massive inflows
events.description: Apollo Global Management reported over $60 billion in inflows in 2018, following the dropped SEC investigation and Kushner dealings.

events.title: Whistleblower receives threatening call
events.description: Christopher Dilorio alleges he received an anonymous, threatening phone call, which he interprets as intimidation following his complaints.

keyFacts: The whistleblower, Christopher Dilorio, alleges the SEC is corrupt and facilitates financial fraud by allowing abusive naked short selling and money laundering through shell companies.

Dilorio claims a direct connection between Apollo Global Management (Leon Black, Joshua Harris, Marc Rowan), Jeffrey Epstein, and Jared Kushner, centered on the shell company Environmental Solutions Worldwide (ESWW).

The document alleges the SEC dropped an investigation into Apollo shortly after Apollo provided a $180 million loan to Kushner's family business, and after Kushner met with Apollo's Joshua Harris at the White House.
Dilorio points to George Economou and Marc Bistricer's dealings with DryShips as another example of an alleged money laundering operation with tangential connections to Kushner and Apollo.
The email chain serves as a formal complaint and threat of legal action against the SEC for obstruction, with Dilorio repeatedly challenging officials to refute his claims.
